original_solution_mapping.L2: Since he has 16 slices, Shane makes 16 sandwiches.
original_solution_mapping.L3: With 2 packages of sliced bread, he has 20 * 2 = <<20*2=40>>40 slices of bread.
original_solution_mapping.L4: To make the 16 sandwiches, he needs 16 * 2 = <<16*2=32>>32 slices of bread.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5316.
    Returns: the number of slices of bread Shane will have leftover.
    """
    # L1
    num_ham_packages = 2 # 2 packages of sliced ham
    slices_per_ham_package = 8 # 8 slices each
    total_ham_slices = num_ham_packages * slices_per_ham_package

    # L2
    num_sandwiches_made = total_ham_slices # makes as many sandwiches as he can according to the ham he has

    # L3
    slices_per_bread_package = 20 # 20 slices each
    num_bread_packages = 2 # 2 packages of sliced bread
    total_bread_slices = slices_per_bread_package * num_bread_packages

    # L4
    slices_per_sandwich = 2 # WK
    bread_needed = num_sandwiches_made * slices_per_sandwich

    # L5
    bread_leftover = total_bread_slices - bread_needed

    # FA
    answer = bread_leftover
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: With {num_ham_packages} packages of sliced ham, Shane has {num_ham_packages} * {slices_per_ham_package} = <<{num_ham_packages}*{slices_per_ham_package}={total_ham_slices}>>{total_ham_slices} slices of ham.
Since he has {total_ham_slices} slices, Shane makes {num_sandwiches_made} sandwiches.

With {num_bread_packages} packages of sliced bread, he has {slices_per_bread_package} * {num_bread_packages} = <<{slices_per_bread_package}*{num_bread_packages}={total_bread_slices}>>{total_bread_slices} slices of bread.
To make the {num_sandwiches_made} sandwiches, he needs {num_sandwiches_made} * {slices_per_sandwich} = <<{num_sandwiches_made}*{slices_per_sandwich}={bread_needed}>>{bread_needed} slices of bread.
He has {total_bread_slices} - {bread_needed} = <<{total_bread_slices}-{bread_needed}={bread_leftover}>>{bread_leftover} slices of bread leftover.
